alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Cass (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 6:43AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CDT/1045 AM EDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana and southwest Michigan, including the following counties, in northern Indiana, La Porte and St. Joseph IN. In southwest Michigan, Berrien and Cass MI. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CDT /1045 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 542 AM CDT /642 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... South Bend, Mishawaka, Michigan City, La Porte, Niles, St. Joseph, Dowagiac, Westville, Buchanan, Georgetown, Trail Creek, Gulivoire Park, Granger, Fair Plain, Osceola, Bridgman, North Liberty, New Buffalo, New Carlisle and Berrien Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
